definition: one side/either side/on the one hand/on the other hand/doing while
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
suffix of a noun of locality
to have the advantage overwhelmingly on one side/to support unconditionally

sentences.english: As they picked tea, the girls sang happily.
sentences.chinese: 姑娘们一边采茶，一边愉快地唱歌。

sentences.english: As they picked tea, the girls sang happily.
sentences.chinese: 姑娘们一边采茶，一边愉快地唱歌。

sentences.english: Guo eat while watching the picture storybook side starch noodles.
sentences.chinese: 郭同学一边看小人书一边吃炒粉。

sentences.english: Guo eat while watching the picture storybook side starch noodles.
sentences.chinese: 郭同学一边看小人书一边吃炒粉。

sentences.english: “Take that out right now and warm it under water, ” I say.
sentences.chinese: “把那东西拿到一边去，在水里温一温，”我说。

sentences.english: The jury sided with Christofferson-Titchbourne, awarding her thirty-nine million dollars.
sentences.chinese: 陪审团站在朱莉一边，判她应得3900万美元。

sentences.english: On the other side is northern Xinjiang.
The river is beyond the hill.
Stir in the rice and boil until just done, about 10 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 一边加入大米一边调和直到煮沸，大约10分钟。

sentences.english: Stir in the rice and boil until just done, about 10 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 一边加入大米一边调和直到煮沸，大约10分钟。

sentences.english: The bus driver chews his sandwich and watches us in the overhead mirror.
sentences.chinese: 司机一边从后视镜里看戏一边嚼着三明治。

sentences.english: The bus driver chews his sandwich and watches us in the overhead mirror.
sentences.chinese: 司机一边从后视镜里看戏一边嚼着三明治。

sentences.english: On the other side of the brook, there are many trees. There are lots of green bamboo groves.
sentences.chinese: 在小河的一边有许多树木，还有一片翠绿的竹林。

sentences.english: The little girls sang as they went.
sentences.chinese: 小姑娘们一边走，一边唱。

sentences.english: The little girls sang as they went.
sentences.chinese: 小姑娘们一边走，一边唱。

definition: suffix of a noun of locality
relevant/to the point/has sth to do with the matter (also used with negative)
to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
aspect particle indicating action in progress
to do one's utmost/with all one's might/at all costs/(to work or fight) as if one's life depends on it
solely preoccupied (with one thing)/engrossed/focusing (on sth)/to look after only one aspect
